title: K-12 Online Mathematics Leadership Development Program for Volunteer Sector Leaders

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical concepts comprehension and administrative management experience
context.additional_context: Emphasizing Mathematical Decision-Making Competencies for the Efficient Operation of Volunteer Activities

learning_goals: Within one week, learners calculate ≥3 basic statistics (mean, standard deviation, trend analysis) using Excel or Google Sheets for volunteer project budget planning and write a 1-page budget allocation recommendation based on analysis results

Within one week, learners model ≥3 interdepartmental resource allocation scenarios using real-time collaboration tools (Google Sheets, Miro, etc.), write simulation result reports, and demonstrate ≥4/5 average feasibility via peer evaluation on a 5-point scale

Learners can define three or more key performance indicators (KPIs) for volunteer activities using smartphone-based tools (e.g., Google Forms, SurveyMonkey) and submit a performance measurement framework within one week, specifying measurement methods for each indicator (e.g., service hours, participant satisfaction, community impact).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
